title: Is anyone blogging TypeCon?
content: I've been scouring Typophile and even looked at the \*second page\* of Google results, and I've got nuthin'. Is anyone blogging TypeCon this year?
author: Christian Robertson

comments.content:
Joe Pemberton is promising a minute-by-minute  
 [http://typophile.com/node/35598](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107174300/http:/typophile.com/node/35598 "http://typophile.com/node/35598")

[http://typophile.com/blog/1160](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107174300/http:/typophile.com/blog/1160 "http://typophile.com/blog/1160")

Tim
Haha, not minute-by-minute... but I'm blogging from my iPhone where I happen to be, when it happens. Christian, you're missed up here. Sorry you couldn't make it. =/

Eek! That's me!

Well, I hope you find it interesting. :)

I found it interesting. I was present for the conversation between you and Stephen Coles, and I found it very touching. How much of a response or feedback did you get from Positronic Toaster from others?

If you're asking about comments on the development of the face, there were some other comments here at Typophile (which I very much appreciated as well), but other than that, I've just been working on my own.

As for the gallery showing, most of the people I talked to hadn't been to the gallery at the time I spoke with them, so I'm not sure what the response to it was.
